citations.narrative:
Records were not available for a newly acquired amazon parrot named "Figaro." The licensee recently had acquired the
bird, however the information which is required per this section of the AWA had not been documented. Records must be
maintained for all animals in the facility and must be updated with the required information, including date of acquisition
and species of animal. The licensee corrected this issue at the time of the inspection.

A Contingency Plan had been documented for the facility, however annual reviews are not being conducted as required.
The facility must review the plan on an annual basis, and the date of review and plan revisions, if any, must be
documented. The licensee must correct this issue.
*****Correct by April 19, 2025

Two Capybaras are currently housed in enclosures in the indoor winter building. The enclosures do not provide a pool or
a water feature, other than the animals drinking water. Capybaras are a semi aquatic species, and the space of their
enclosure should allow for submersion and swimming behaviors in addition to defecation. This needs to be addressed for
the health of the animals. The licensee corrected this issue at the time of inspection by offering water pools to both
capybara enclosures.
******Corrected on March 19, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Records were not available for a newly acquired amazon parrot named "Figaro." The licensee recently had acquired the 
bird, however the information which is required per this section of the AWA had not been documented. Records must be 
maintained for all animals in the facility and must be updated with the required information, including date of acquisition 
and species of animal. The licensee corrected this issue at the time of the inspection. 
2.134(b) 
   
Contingency planning. 
A Contingency Plan had been documented for the facility, however annual reviews are not being conducted as required. 
The facility must review the plan on an annual basis, and the date of review and plan revisions, if any, must be 
documented. The licensee must correct this issue. 
*****Correct by April 19, 2025 
3.128 
   
Space requirements. 
Two Capybaras are currently housed in enclosures in the indoor winter building. The enclosures do not provide a pool or 
a water feature, other than the animals drinking water. Capybaras are a semi aquatic species, and the space of their 
enclosure should allow for submersion and swimming behaviors in addition to defecation. This needs to be addressed for 
the health of the animals. The licensee corrected this issue at the time of inspection by offering water pools to both 
capybara enclosures.  
******Corrected on March 19, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
